title: BACON & JALAPENO POPPER GRILLED CHEESE SANDWICHES heart emoticon heart emoticon Serves 4
directions: 1.Set your oven to broil. Place the jalapenos on a baking sheet & broil for about 3 minutes on each side, until the skins are charred. Immedietly place the jalapenos into a ziploc bag, or well sealed container, for about 15 minutes. Remove & peel off the skins & remove the seeds.

2.Combine the cream cheese & shredded mexican cheese. Spread it evenly between the 4 slices of bread. Top with the cooked bacon. Divide the jalapenos between all 4 slices of bread. Top with the remaining slices of bread.
3.Melt some butter in a skillet & fry each sandwich on both sides until nicely browned.
4.Cut in half, and serve. (Recipe from: Mrs. Happy Homemaker)
ingredients: •8-10 jalapenos (depending on the size…8 if large, more if not)
